					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Privacy Policy]]></title>
		<link>https://www.bystandersnomore.com/?page_id=19333</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 05 Apr 2021 07:23:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[a56dfb_C0l8y]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://bystandersnomore.com/?page_id=3</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:heading --><h2>Who we are</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Our website address is: http://localhost/gutenbergdev.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>What personal data we collect and why we collect it</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Comments</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor&#8217;s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Media</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Contact forms</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Cookies</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select &quot;Remember Me&quot;, your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Embedded content from other websites</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Analytics</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Who we share your data with</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>How long we retain your data</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>What rights you have over your data</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Where we send your data</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:paragraph --><p>Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.</p><!-- /wp:paragraph --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Your contact information</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading --><h2>Additional information</h2><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>How we protect your data</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>What data breach procedures we have in place</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>What third parties we receive data from</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data</h3><!-- /wp:heading --><!-- wp:heading {"level":3} --><h3>Industry regulatory disclosure requirements</h3><!-- /wp:heading -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Survey - OLD]]></title>
		<link>https://www.bystandersnomore.com/survey-june/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 14 Jun 2024 06:53:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Vanessa_bsnm]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.bystandersnomore.com/?page_id=422</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:group {"align":"full","style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"},"padding":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|20","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|20","left":"var:preset|spacing|30","right":"var:preset|spacing|30"}}},"backgroundColor":"accent","layout":{"type":"constrained"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group alignfull has-accent-background-color has-background" style="margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--20);padding-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);padding-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--20);padding-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30)"><!-- wp:columns {"align":"wide","style":{"spacing":{"blockGap":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","left":"var:preset|spacing|20"}}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-columns alignwide"><!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"stretch","width":"50%"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-stretch" style="flex-basis:50%"><!-- wp:group {"style":{"dimensions":{"minHeight":"100%"}},"layout":{"type":"flex","orientation":"vertical","justifyContent":"stretch","verticalAlignment":"space-between"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group" style="min-height:100%"><!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"layout":{"selfStretch":"fit","flexSize":null}},"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">An informal anonymous survey consisting of Likert-scale questions and freeform responses was carried out between May-June 2024, and completed by 248 participants. The largest subset: </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><!-- wp:list-item {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<li class="has-medium-font-size">lived in the United Kingdom and United States (42.5%)</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<li class="has-medium-font-size">was between 35-54 years old (49.3%)</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<li class="has-medium-font-size">was predominantly White/Caucasian (62.5%)</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<li class="has-medium-font-size">were women (60.5%)</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item --></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:image {"id":19669,"width":"226px","height":"auto","sizeSlug":"medium","linkDestination":"none","style":{"color":{"duotone":"unset"}}} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-medium is-resized"><img src="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Enablers-Barriers-200x300.png" alt="" class="wp-image-19669" style="width:226px;height:auto"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">Responses showed that when the <strong>enablers</strong> of speaking up (moral outrage and gains in action-promoting knowledge) outweigh the <strong>barriers</strong> (feeling inadequately informed, potential risk, and feeling ineffectual), people find their public voice.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:group {"layout":{"type":"constrained","contentSize":"300px","justifyContent":"left"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><!-- wp:buttons -->
<div class="wp-block-buttons"><!-- wp:button {"backgroundColor":"custom-colour-1"} -->
<div class="wp-block-button"><a class="wp-block-button__link has-custom-colour-1-background-color has-background wp-element-button" href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/BNM-Report-Summary_26-June_v2.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">See report summary</a></div>
<!-- /wp:button --></div>
<!-- /wp:buttons --></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"center","width":"50%"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-center" style="flex-basis:50%"><!-- wp:image {"id":19675,"width":"578px","height":"auto","aspectRatio":"0.75","scale":"cover","sizeSlug":"large","linkDestination":"none","style":{"color":{"duotone":"unset"}},"className":"is-style-default"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-large is-resized is-style-default"><img src="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Survey-questions_crop-754x1024.png" alt="" class="wp-image-19675" style="aspect-ratio:0.75;object-fit:cover;width:578px;height:auto"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:separator {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|30","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|30"}}},"backgroundColor":"contrast-2","className":"is-style-wide"} -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-text-color has-contrast-2-color has-alpha-channel-opacity has-contrast-2-background-color has-background is-style-wide" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30)"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:quote {"className":"is-style-default"} -->
<blockquote class="wp-block-quote is-style-default"><!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|custom-colour-1"}}}},"textColor":"custom-colour-1"} -->
<p class="has-custom-colour-1-color has-text-color has-link-color">I realized my silence was part of the problem. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --><cite>- Survey respondent</cite></blockquote>
<!-- /wp:quote --></div>
<!-- /wp:group -->

<!-- wp:separator {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|30","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|30"}}},"backgroundColor":"contrast-2","className":"is-style-wide"} -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-text-color has-contrast-2-color has-alpha-channel-opacity has-contrast-2-background-color has-background is-style-wide" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30)"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:group {"align":"full","style":{"spacing":{"padding":{"top":"0","bottom":"0","left":"var:preset|spacing|20","right":"var:preset|spacing|20"},"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"}}},"backgroundColor":"accent-5","layout":{"type":"constrained"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group alignfull has-accent-5-background-color has-background" style="margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-top:0;padding-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--20);padding-bottom:0;padding-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--20)"><!-- wp:columns {"align":"wide","style":{"spacing":{"blockGap":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","left":"var:preset|spacing|50"}}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-columns alignwide"><!-- wp:column {"verticalAlignment":"center","width":"60%"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column is-vertically-aligned-center" style="flex-basis:60%"><!-- wp:image {"id":19665,"width":"549px","height":"auto","aspectRatio":"1.3333333333333333","scale":"contain","sizeSlug":"full","linkDestination":"none","style":{"color":{"duotone":"unset"}},"className":"is-style-default"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image size-full is-resized is-style-default"><img src="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Survey-chart.png" alt="" class="wp-image-19665" style="aspect-ratio:1.3333333333333333;object-fit:contain;width:549px;height:auto"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"width":"40%"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column" style="flex-basis:40%"><!-- wp:paragraph -->
<p></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">Most survey participants support Palestinian human rights and had said so publicly by the time the case for plausible genocide had been established by the International Court of Justice (ICJ) on 26 January 2024.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">Reasons for delaying speaking up, and the proportion of the sample for whom that reason was relevant, are summarised here from highest to lowest. Future research with a non-skewed sample is required.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:buttons -->
<div class="wp-block-buttons"><!-- wp:button {"backgroundColor":"custom-colour-1"} -->
<div class="wp-block-button"><a class="wp-block-button__link has-custom-colour-1-background-color has-background wp-element-button" href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/BNM-Report-Full_26-June_v2_compressed.pdf">See full report</a></div>
<!-- /wp:button --></div>
<!-- /wp:buttons --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns --></div>
<!-- /wp:group -->

<!-- wp:group {"metadata":{"name":"Team members"},"align":"full","style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"},"padding":{"top":"0","bottom":"0","left":"0","right":"0"}}},"layout":{"type":"constrained"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group alignfull" style="margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-top:0;padding-right:0;padding-bottom:0;padding-left:0"><!-- wp:heading {"textAlign":"center","style":{"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|custom-colour-1"}}}},"textColor":"custom-colour-1","fontSize":"xx-large"} -->
<h2 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center has-custom-colour-1-color has-text-color has-link-color has-xx-large-font-size">Conclusion</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">Overall, the results tend to validate observations from social media in terms of what holds people back from speaking up and what finally empowers them to do so. The survey also successfully prompted people within BNMs network to raise a voice they were previously struggling to find. The numeric data from this survey helps quantify the size and spread of trends, and the qualitative data (e.g. freeform text responses) capture some nuances that numbers cannot. These initial findings and feedback are being used by BNM to guide the selection of educational materials and future work in support of human rights that reaches the intended audience of BNM  bystanders. This may include, for example, collaborating with anti-Zionist Jewish groups and workers unions. </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">To access the full survey report, <a href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/BNM-Report-Full_26-June_v2_compressed.pdf" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/BNM-Report_Full.pdf">click here</a>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"6px"} -->
<div style="height:6px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer --></div>
<!-- /wp:group -->]]></content:encoded>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_menu_item_menu_item_parent]]></wp:meta_key>

					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Take Action*]]></title>
		<link>https://www.bystandersnomore.com/?page_id=19922</link>
		<pubDate></pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[russell_bsnm]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.bystandersnomore.com/?page_id=19922</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:group {"metadata":{"name":"Testimonial","categories":["testimonials"],"patternName":"twentytwentyfour/testimonial-centered"},"align":"full","style":{"spacing":{"padding":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|60","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|60","left":"var:preset|spacing|60","right":"var:preset|spacing|60"},"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"}}},"backgroundColor":"contrast","textColor":"base","layout":{"type":"constrained","contentSize":""}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group alignfull has-base-color has-contrast-background-color has-text-color has-background" style="margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--60);padding-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--60);padding-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--60);padding-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--60)"><!-- wp:group {"layout":{"type":"constrained"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","style":{"typography":{"lineHeight":"1.2"}},"textColor":"base","fontSize":"large","fontFamily":"heading"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center has-base-color has-text-color has-heading-font-family has-large-font-size" style="line-height:1.2"><em>Once there is seeing, there must be acting.</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","style":{"typography":{"lineHeight":"1.2"}},"textColor":"base","fontSize":"large","fontFamily":"heading"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center has-base-color has-text-color has-heading-font-family has-large-font-size" style="line-height:1.2"><em>Otherwise, what's the use of seeing?</em></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"var:preset|spacing|10"} -->
<div style="height:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:group {"metadata":{"name":"Testimonial source"},"style":{"spacing":{"blockGap":"0"}},"layout":{"type":"flex","orientation":"vertical","justifyContent":"center","flexWrap":"nowrap"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><!-- wp:image {"width":"60px","aspectRatio":"1","scale":"cover","sizeSlug":"thumbnail","linkDestination":"none","align":"center","style":{"border":{"radius":"100px"}}} -->
<figure class="wp-block-image aligncenter size-thumbnail is-resized has-custom-border"><img alt="" style="border-radius:100px;aspect-ratio:1;object-fit:cover;width:60px"/></figure>
<!-- /wp:image -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"0"}}}} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:0">Thich Nhat Hahn</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center","style":{"typography":{"fontStyle":"normal","fontWeight":"300"}},"textColor":"contrast-3","fontSize":"small"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center has-contrast-3-color has-text-color has-small-font-size" style="font-style:normal;font-weight:300">Buddhist monk and internationally recognised peace activist </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:group -->

<!-- wp:group {"metadata":{"categories":["call-to-action"],"patternName":"twentytwentyfour/page-newsletter-landing","name":"Newsletter landing"},"align":"full","style":{"spacing":{"padding":{"right":"var:preset|spacing|50","left":"var:preset|spacing|50","top":"var:preset|spacing|60","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|60"},"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"}},"dimensions":{"minHeight":"100vh"}},"backgroundColor":"accent-3","layout":{"type":"flex","orientation":"vertical","justifyContent":"center","verticalAlignment":"center"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group alignfull has-accent-3-background-color has-background" style="min-height:100vh;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--60);padding-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50);padding-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--60);padding-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50)"><!-- wp:group {"layout":{"type":"constrained"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><!-- wp:spacer {"height":"var:preset|spacing|10"} -->
<div style="height:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:heading {"textAlign":"center","style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"right":"0","left":"0"},"padding":{"right":"0","left":"0"}},"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|contrast"}}}},"textColor":"contrast","fontSize":"x-large"} -->
<h2 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center has-contrast-color has-text-color has-link-color has-x-large-font-size" style="margin-right:0;margin-left:0;padding-right:0;padding-left:0"><em>Bystanders No More</em> exists to help you take actions that are true to <strong>who you are</strong>, and to help you consider whether who you are today (i.e. what you do and you dont do) is consistent with <strong>who you want to be</strong>.</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"align":"center"} -->
<p class="has-text-align-center"><strong>We will not tell you what to do.</strong> Instead, we will show you some of the things that we, as former bystanders, are now doing.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:group --></div>
<!-- /wp:group -->

<!-- wp:group {"metadata":{"name":"Research links"},"align":"full","style":{"spacing":{"padding":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|40","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|40","left":"var:preset|spacing|40","right":"var:preset|spacing|40"},"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"}},"color":{"background":"#eeeeee"}},"layout":{"type":"constrained"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group alignfull has-background" style="background-color:#eeeeee;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40);padding-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40);padding-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40);padding-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40)"><!-- wp:spacer {"height":"10px"} -->
<div style="height:10px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:heading {"align":"wide","fontSize":"x-large"} -->
<h2 class="wp-block-heading alignwide has-x-large-font-size">There are several paths to taking action and they all connect.</h2>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"padding":{"right":"0","left":"0"}}},"fontSize":"x-large"} -->
<p class="has-x-large-font-size" style="padding-right:0;padding-left:0">Questions to consider:</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"30px"} -->
<div style="height:30px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:columns {"metadata":{"name":"Cards"},"align":"wide","style":{"spacing":{"blockGap":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|50","left":"var:preset|spacing|10"},"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"},"padding":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"}}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-columns alignwide" style="margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0"><!-- wp:column {"metadata":{"name":"Card 1: Research - survey"},"style":{"shadow":"var:preset|shadow|natural"},"backgroundColor":"base"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column has-base-background-color has-background" style="box-shadow:var(--wp--preset--shadow--natural)"><!-- wp:spacer {"height":"50px"} -->
<div style="height:50px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10","left":"var:preset|spacing|10","right":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}},"fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-large-font-size" style="margin-top:0;margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)">Policies</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"padding":{"top":"0","bottom":"0","left":"var:preset|spacing|30","right":"var:preset|spacing|30"}}},"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size" style="padding-top:0;padding-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);padding-bottom:0;padding-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30)">Here are some policies that governments could adopt to de-escalate the conflict and build peace with justice. Each country is different, so please check what your government is doing or not doing on any given issue. Given the power of the Israel lobby and its international allies, no government is likely to do everything it could do without considerable bottom-up pressure. Concerted pressure by neutrals could play a big role...</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"10px"} -->
<div style="height:10px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:buttons {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}},"layout":{"type":"flex","verticalAlignment":"bottom","justifyContent":"center"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-buttons" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)"><!-- wp:button {"textAlign":"center","backgroundColor":"contrast","textColor":"base","width":75,"className":"is-style-fill","style":{"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|base"}}},"border":{"width":"4px","color":"#e9e9e9"},"spacing":{"padding":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-button has-custom-width wp-block-button__width-75 is-style-fill"><a class="wp-block-button__link has-base-color has-contrast-background-color has-text-color has-background has-link-color has-border-color has-text-align-center wp-element-button" href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/survey/" style="border-color:#e9e9e9;border-width:4px;padding-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);padding-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)">What policies could I lobby for?</a></div>
<!-- /wp:button --></div>
<!-- /wp:buttons -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"50px"} -->
<div style="height:50px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"metadata":{"name":"Card 2: Summary report"},"style":{"shadow":"var:preset|shadow|natural"},"backgroundColor":"base"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column has-base-background-color has-background" style="box-shadow:var(--wp--preset--shadow--natural)"><!-- wp:spacer {"height":"50px"} -->
<div style="height:50px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10","left":"var:preset|spacing|10","right":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}},"fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-large-font-size" style="margin-top:0;margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)">Organizations</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|30","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10","left":"var:preset|spacing|30","right":"var:preset|spacing|30"}}},"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30)">As a focused volunteer initiative that wont be fundraising, BNM does not seek to become a permanent organisation. Rather, we hope that those who come through this site will find established groups that they want to support. Here are some&nbsp;<a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IMOjSXa9sJlTk7rClAOxIYTLLnnM_b8fx-n8I0XHOrE/edit?usp=sharing">organisations</a>&nbsp;that you might like to consider...</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"10px"} -->
<div style="height:10px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:buttons {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}},"layout":{"type":"flex","justifyContent":"center"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-buttons" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)"><!-- wp:button {"textAlign":"center","backgroundColor":"contrast","textColor":"base","width":75,"className":"is-style-outline","style":{"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|base"}}},"border":{"color":"#e9e9e9","width":"4px"},"spacing":{"padding":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-button has-custom-width wp-block-button__width-75 is-style-outline"><a class="wp-block-button__link has-base-color has-contrast-background-color has-text-color has-background has-link-color has-border-color has-text-align-center wp-element-button" href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/BNM-Report-Summary_26-June_v2.pdf" style="border-color:#e9e9e9;border-width:4px;padding-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);padding-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)">Which organisations could I support?</a></div>
<!-- /wp:button --></div>
<!-- /wp:buttons -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"50px"} -->
<div style="height:50px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"metadata":{"name":"Card 3: Full report"},"style":{"shadow":"var:preset|shadow|natural"},"backgroundColor":"base"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column has-base-background-color has-background" style="box-shadow:var(--wp--preset--shadow--natural)"><!-- wp:spacer {"height":"50px"} -->
<div style="height:50px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10","left":"var:preset|spacing|10","right":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}},"fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-large-font-size" style="margin-top:0;margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)">Speak Out</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|30","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|20","left":"var:preset|spacing|40","right":"var:preset|spacing|40"}}},"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--20);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40)">There are many ways to take a stand without posting on social media.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|30","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|20","left":"var:preset|spacing|40","right":"var:preset|spacing|40"}}},"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--20);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40)"><strong>Participate in the BDS Movement:&nbsp;</strong>Involvement in the BDS movement is a powerful way of showing that you care about what is happening to Palestinians. Activism can take many forms, from on-ground protests to targeted boycotts... </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"10px"} -->
<div style="height:10px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:buttons {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}},"layout":{"type":"flex","justifyContent":"center"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-buttons" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)"><!-- wp:button {"textAlign":"center","backgroundColor":"contrast","textColor":"base","width":75,"className":"is-style-outline","style":{"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|base"}}},"border":{"color":"#e9e9e9","width":"4px"},"spacing":{"padding":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-button has-custom-width wp-block-button__width-75 is-style-outline"><a class="wp-block-button__link has-base-color has-contrast-background-color has-text-color has-background has-link-color has-border-color has-text-align-center wp-element-button" href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/BNM-Report-Full_26-June_v2_compressed.pdf" style="border-color:#e9e9e9;border-width:4px;padding-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);padding-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)">How can I speak out without using social media?</a></div>
<!-- /wp:button --></div>
<!-- /wp:buttons -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"50px"} -->
<div style="height:50px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns --></div>
<!-- /wp:group -->

<!-- wp:group {"metadata":{"name":"Research links"},"align":"full","style":{"spacing":{"padding":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|40","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|40","left":"var:preset|spacing|40","right":"var:preset|spacing|40"},"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"}},"color":{"background":"#eeeeee"}},"layout":{"type":"constrained"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group alignfull has-background" style="background-color:#eeeeee;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40);padding-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40);padding-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40);padding-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40)"><!-- wp:columns {"metadata":{"name":"Cards"},"align":"wide","style":{"spacing":{"blockGap":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|50","left":"var:preset|spacing|10"},"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"},"padding":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"}}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-columns alignwide" style="margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-top:0;padding-bottom:0"><!-- wp:column {"metadata":{"name":"Card 1: Research - survey"},"style":{"shadow":"var:preset|shadow|natural"},"backgroundColor":"base"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column has-base-background-color has-background" style="box-shadow:var(--wp--preset--shadow--natural)"><!-- wp:spacer {"height":"50px"} -->
<div style="height:50px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10","left":"var:preset|spacing|10","right":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}},"fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-large-font-size" style="margin-top:0;margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)">Conversation</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|30","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|20","left":"var:preset|spacing|30","right":"var:preset|spacing|30"}}},"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--20);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30)">Engaging in&nbsp; face to face conversations with trusted friends,&nbsp; family members, colleagues and members of our community is another powerful way to drive change.&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|30","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|20","left":"var:preset|spacing|30","right":"var:preset|spacing|30"}}},"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--20);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30)">While social media and lobbying are crucial, in-person discussions when done in the right conditions, are more likely to inspire people to change their opinion and/or take action for the first time...</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"10px"} -->
<div style="height:10px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:buttons {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}},"layout":{"type":"flex","verticalAlignment":"bottom","justifyContent":"center"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-buttons" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)"><!-- wp:button {"textAlign":"center","backgroundColor":"contrast","textColor":"base","width":75,"className":"is-style-fill","style":{"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|base"}}},"border":{"width":"4px","color":"#e9e9e9"},"spacing":{"padding":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-button has-custom-width wp-block-button__width-75 is-style-fill"><a class="wp-block-button__link has-base-color has-contrast-background-color has-text-color has-background has-link-color has-border-color has-text-align-center wp-element-button" href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/survey/" style="border-color:#e9e9e9;border-width:4px;padding-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);padding-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)">How can I have powerful, constructive conversations on this hard topic?</a></div>
<!-- /wp:button --></div>
<!-- /wp:buttons -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"50px"} -->
<div style="height:50px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"metadata":{"name":"Card 2: Summary report"},"style":{"shadow":"var:preset|shadow|natural"},"backgroundColor":"base"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column has-base-background-color has-background" style="box-shadow:var(--wp--preset--shadow--natural)"><!-- wp:spacer {"height":"50px"} -->
<div style="height:50px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10","left":"var:preset|spacing|10","right":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}},"fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-large-font-size" style="margin-top:0;margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)">Social Media </p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|30","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10","left":"var:preset|spacing|40","right":"var:preset|spacing|40"}}},"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--40)">There is an assumption that we all need to be posting and liking/resharing online. While social media is powerful, it may not be a match for everyone. If you do want to use social media, here are some tips for safer ways to engage.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"10px"} -->
<div style="height:10px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:buttons {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}},"layout":{"type":"flex","justifyContent":"center"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-buttons" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)"><!-- wp:button {"textAlign":"center","backgroundColor":"contrast","textColor":"base","width":75,"className":"is-style-outline","style":{"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|base"}}},"border":{"color":"#e9e9e9","width":"4px"},"spacing":{"padding":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-button has-custom-width wp-block-button__width-75 is-style-outline"><a class="wp-block-button__link has-base-color has-contrast-background-color has-text-color has-background has-link-color has-border-color has-text-align-center wp-element-button" href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/BNM-Report-Summary_26-June_v2.pdf" style="border-color:#e9e9e9;border-width:4px;padding-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);padding-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)">How can I engage in social media advocacy as safely as possible?</a></div>
<!-- /wp:button --></div>
<!-- /wp:buttons -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"50px"} -->
<div style="height:50px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer --></div>
<!-- /wp:column -->

<!-- wp:column {"metadata":{"name":"Card 3: Full report"},"style":{"shadow":"var:preset|shadow|natural"},"backgroundColor":"base"} -->
<div class="wp-block-column has-base-background-color has-background" style="box-shadow:var(--wp--preset--shadow--natural)"><!-- wp:spacer {"height":"50px"} -->
<div style="height:50px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10","left":"var:preset|spacing|10","right":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}},"fontSize":"large"} -->
<p class="has-large-font-size" style="margin-top:0;margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)">Taking care</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|30","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|20","left":"var:preset|spacing|30","right":"var:preset|spacing|30"}}},"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--20);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30)">Bearing witness to a crisis like the one were seeing in Gaza can seriously affect a persons mental health. Ongoing exposure to graphic images, painful first-person testimony and numbing statistics can lead to feelings of helplessness, depression and exhaustion. This section offers some advice on how to deal with those feelings.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|30","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|20","left":"var:preset|spacing|30","right":"var:preset|spacing|30"}}},"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--20);margin-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30)">Stop Policing your Rage: What does care look like?</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"10px"} -->
<div style="height:10px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:buttons {"style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}},"layout":{"type":"flex","justifyContent":"center"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-buttons" style="margin-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);margin-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)"><!-- wp:button {"textAlign":"center","backgroundColor":"contrast","textColor":"base","width":75,"className":"is-style-outline","style":{"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|base"}}},"border":{"color":"#e9e9e9","width":"4px"},"spacing":{"padding":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|10","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|10"}}}} -->
<div class="wp-block-button has-custom-width wp-block-button__width-75 is-style-outline"><a class="wp-block-button__link has-base-color has-contrast-background-color has-text-color has-background has-link-color has-border-color has-text-align-center wp-element-button" href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/BNM-Report-Full_26-June_v2_compressed.pdf" style="border-color:#e9e9e9;border-width:4px;padding-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10);padding-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--10)">How can I take care of myself while watching this genocide unfold?</a></div>
<!-- /wp:button --></div>
<!-- /wp:buttons -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"50px"} -->
<div style="height:50px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer --></div>
<!-- /wp:column --></div>
<!-- /wp:columns -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"10px"} -->
<div style="height:10px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

<!-- wp:spacer {"height":"10px"} -->
<div style="height:10px" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer --></div>
<!-- /wp:group -->

<!-- wp:separator {"opacity":"css","className":"is-style-default"} -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-css-opacity is-style-default"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:quote {"textAlign":"center","className":"is-style-large"} -->
<blockquote class="wp-block-quote has-text-align-center is-style-large"><!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">All these activities are important, but we also need to start somewhere  becoming an empowered change-maker is a process, not an on/off switch! It may be best to build initial momentum with the topic that you feel most confident about: what more can you do in that space? To support your growth, pick the topic where you feel least confident: what is one small thing you can do today that will move you forward?</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></blockquote>
<!-- /wp:quote -->

<!-- wp:separator {"opacity":"css","className":"is-style-default"} -->
<hr class="wp-block-separator has-css-opacity is-style-default"/>
<!-- /wp:separator -->

<!-- wp:group {"metadata":{"categories":["testimonials"],"patternName":"clients-section","name":"Clients Section"},"align":"full","style":{"spacing":{"padding":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|50","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|50","left":"var:preset|spacing|50","right":"var:preset|spacing|50"},"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"}}},"layout":{"type":"constrained"}} -->

<!-- /wp:group -->

<!-- wp:group {"metadata":{"name":"Team members","categories":["team"],"patternName":"twentytwentyfour/team-4-col"},"align":"full","style":{"spacing":{"margin":{"top":"0","bottom":"0"},"padding":{"top":"var:preset|spacing|50","bottom":"var:preset|spacing|50","left":"var:preset|spacing|50","right":"var:preset|spacing|50"}}},"layout":{"type":"constrained"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group alignfull" style="margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;padding-top:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50);padding-right:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50);padding-bottom:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50);padding-left:var(--wp--preset--spacing--50)"><!-- wp:spacer {"height":"var:preset|spacing|30"} -->
<div style="height:var(--wp--preset--spacing--30)" aria-hidden="true" class="wp-block-spacer"></div>
<!-- /wp:spacer -->

														</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[What policies could I lobby for?]]></title>
		<link>https://www.bystandersnomore.com/take-action/policies/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Jun 2024 07:35:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Vanessa_bsnm]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.bystandersnomore.com/?p=454</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">Here are some policies that governments could adopt to de-escalate the conflict and build peace with justice. Each country is different, so please check what your government is doing or not doing on any given issue. Given the power of the Israel lobby and its international allies, no government is likely to do everything it could do without considerable bottom-up pressure. Concerted pressure by neutrals could play a big role in changing how politicians think and act, and there are many ways to exert this pressure - <a href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/take-action/advocacy-without-social-media/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/take-action/advocacy-without-social-media/">lobbying elected officials,</a> <a href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/take-action/advocacy-without-social-media/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/take-action/advocacy-without-social-media/">lobbying the media</a>, <a href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/take-action/social-media-advocacy/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/take-action/social-media-advocacy/">using social media</a> or <a href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/take-action/organisations-to-support/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/take-action/organisations-to-support/">supporting organisations.</a></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">We will cover the following policies in this order, which is our understanding of what is most important and urgent. Please <a href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/contact-us/">tell us</a> if you think there are other policies we should be featuring.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:list -->
<ul><!-- wp:list-item {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<li class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>A.</strong> An immediate and permanent ceasefire, sufficient humanitarian provision, adequate funding for UNRWA and solid protection for humanitarian staff</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<li class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>B.</strong> A ban on the export of weapons to Israel</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<li class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>C</strong>. Legal accountability  support for the ICC and the ICJ</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<li class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>D</strong>. Release of all illegally detained persons</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<li class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>E.</strong> Ensure the international media and UN have unhindered access to Palestine</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item -->

<!-- wp:list-item {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<li class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>F.</strong> Recognition of the state of Palestine</li>
<!-- /wp:list-item --></ul>
<!-- /wp:list -->

<!-- wp:group {"layout":{"type":"constrained"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-group"><!-- wp:heading {"textAlign":"center","level":3,"style":{"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|custom-colour-1"}}},"typography":{"fontSize":"1.3rem"}},"textColor":"custom-colour-1"} -->
<h3 class="wp-block-heading has-text-align-center has-custom-colour-1-color has-text-color has-link-color" style="font-size:1.3rem"><strong>Call for an immediate &amp; permanent ceasefire with a huge increase in humanitarian aid</strong></h3>
<!-- /wp:heading -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|custom-colour-1"}}}},"textColor":"custom-colour-1","fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-custom-colour-1-color has-text-color has-link-color has-medium-font-size"><strong>What is a ceasefire?&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">It is the process of suspending any and all attacks through war or armed conflict on a region and its people.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|custom-colour-1"}}}},"textColor":"custom-colour-1","fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-custom-colour-1-color has-text-color has-link-color has-medium-font-size"><strong>Why immediate and permanent?</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">Since October 7th 2023, Israel intensified its military activity in Gaza and launched a devastating military campaign.&nbsp; It is reported to have killed nearly forty thousand people and wounded over eighty thousand. There are, however, <a href="https://archive.is/RFONu#selection-1313.0-1313.11">strong reasons</a> for concluding that the actual numbers are probably <a href="https://www.mekomit.co.il/%d7%9e%d7%a1%d7%a4%d7%a8%d7%99-%d7%94%d7%94%d7%a8%d7%95%d7%92%d7%99%d7%9d-%d7%91%d7%a2%d7%96%d7%94-%d7%9b%d7%a0%d7%a8%d7%90%d7%94-%d7%92%d7%91%d7%95%d7%94%d7%99%d7%9d-%d7%a4%d7%99-%d7%a9%d7%9c%d7%95/">three times these reported numbers</a>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">In its assaults, Israel has <a href="https://doi.org/10.20529/IJME.2024.038">systematically attacked healthcare systems and aid professionals, </a>creating a burden of care no current healthcare infrastructure in Gaza can take on.&nbsp;<a href="https://edition.cnn.com/middleeast/live-news/israel-hamas-war-gaza-news-06-12-24-intl#h_62b52a4f2955014cfbae0f0da61eab5e">The UN estimates that 1 million plus Palestinians are facing death by starvation by mid-July</a> 2024.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>An immediate and permanent ceasefire is necessary to combat an impending famine and to provide displaced, wounded and disabled Palestinians access to humanitarian aid in Gaza.</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"style":{"elements":{"link":{"color":{"text":"var:preset|color|custom-colour-1"}}}},"textColor":"custom-colour-1","fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-custom-colour-1-color has-text-color has-link-color has-medium-font-size"><strong>How can you help?</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">International aid agencies have confirmed they can mobilize as soon as Israel allows land access and stops military action. However, the main agency providing aid, UNRWA, has recently seen its major donor, the USA, cut funding and political support.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">Advocate locally for your governments to call for an immediate and permanent ceasefire in Gaza.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size"><strong>Push your local representatives and governments to start/ continue funding <a href="https://www.unrwa.org">UNRWA</a>.&nbsp;</strong></p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size"><a href="https://www.unrwa.org/who-we-are">[Read More</a>: United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees (UNRWA) is funded almost entirely by voluntary contributions from UN Member States]. <a href="https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/2/1/what-is-unrwa-and-why-it-is-important-for-palestinians">Several countries that have recognised Palestinian sovereignty have yet to commit to funding UNRWA</a>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph --></div>
<!-- /wp:group -->

<!-- wp:buttons {"layout":{"type":"flex","justifyContent":"center"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-buttons"><!-- wp:button {"textAlign":"center","width":50} -->
<div class="wp-block-button has-custom-width wp-block-button__width-50"><a class="wp-block-button__link has-text-align-center wp-element-button" href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/take-action/">Return to Take Action page</a></div>
<!-- /wp:button --></div>
<!-- /wp:buttons -->]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>454</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date><![CDATA[2024-06-21 08:35:29]]></wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt><![CDATA[2024-06-21 07:35:29]]></wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:post_modified><![CDATA[2024-07-12 19:53:52]]></wp:post_modified>
		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2024-07-12 18:53:52]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[policies]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="take-action"><![CDATA[Take Action]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[4]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_page_template]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[default]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>

							</item>
					<item>
		<title><![CDATA[Which organisations could I support?]]></title>
		<link>https://www.bystandersnomore.com/take-action/organisations-to-support/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Jun 2024 07:57:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[Vanessa_bsnm]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.bystandersnomore.com/?p=456</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<!-- wp:paragraph {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<p class="has-medium-font-size">As a focused volunteer initiative that wont be fundraising, BNM does not seek to become a permanent organisation. Rather, we hope that those who come through this site will find established groups that they want to support. Here are some <a href="https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IMOjSXa9sJlTk7rClAOxIYTLLnnM_b8fx-n8I0XHOrE/edit?usp=sharing">organisations</a> that you might like to consider. If you know of others, <a href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/contact-us/">please let us know</a>.</p>
<!-- /wp:paragraph -->

<!-- wp:table {"fontSize":"medium"} -->
<figure class="wp-block-table has-medium-font-size"><table><thead><tr><th><strong>NGO</strong></th><th><strong>Country/Region</strong></th><th><strong>Description</strong></th><th><strong>Actions related to Palestine</strong></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><a href="https://apan.org.au/" data-type="link" data-id="https://apan.org.au/">Australia Palestine Advocacy Network</a></td><td>Australia</td><td>Provides a national voice for the many thousands of Australians who are concerned about Israels continuing human rights abuses against Palestinians, and the continuing effects of dispossession and displacement.</td><td>Has condemned the Australian Jewish Association (AJA) for providing a platform to Moshe Feiglin, an extremist Israeli politician known for his genocidal rhetoric.</td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.ecchr.eu/en/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.ecchr.eu/en/">European Center for Constitutional and Human Rights</a></td><td>Europe</td><td>ECCHR uses legal means to end impunity for those responsible for torture, war crimes, sexual and gender-based violence, corporate exploitation and fortressed borders.</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><a href="http://www.france-palestine.org" data-type="link" data-id="www.france-palestine.org">Association France Palestine Solidarit</a></td><td>France</td><td>A 5000 members strong organisation advocating for Palestinian to have the right to self determination. It's organised in local commitees, supporting local actions.</td><td></td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://plateforme-palestine.org/" data-type="link" data-id="https://plateforme-palestine.org/">Platform of French NGOs for Palestine</a></td><td>France</td><td>Be a platform to orchestrate organisations involved in supporting the recognition of a sovereign Palestine based on the 1967 accords. They regroup 41 other NGOs, 28 being members, 13 being observers: <a href="https://plateforme-palestine.org/Les-membres" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener">https://plateforme-palestine.org/Les-membres</a></td><td>Provide resources to help people define antisemitism, organise mobilisations to lobby against EU/Israel agreements, to name a few.</td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://msf.org.uk/" data-type="link" data-id="https://msf.org.uk/">Doctors Without Borders</a></td><td>Worldwide</td><td>International NGO launched by Bernard Kouchner following the war in Kosovo. The organisation is often deployed in conflict areas to support local populations. They currently have a team in Gaza and use their lobbying power to raise awareness and report from the frontline to public organisations, such as UN and governments.</td><td>Share resources on their website and communication on social media about their lobbying effort: <br><a href="https://msf.org.uk/video/gaza-msf-calls-immediate-ceasefire-un-security-council" data-type="link" data-id="https://msf.org.uk/video/gaza-msf-calls-immediate-ceasefire-un-security-council">MSF calls for immediate ceasefire </a><br><a href="https://msf.org.uk/issues/israel-hamas-conflict" data-type="link" data-id="https://msf.org.uk/issues/israel-hamas-conflict">Israel-Hamas conflict</a></td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://actionpalestine.fr/" data-type="link" data-id="https://actionpalestine.fr/">Action Palestine</a></td><td>France</td><td>Civilian initiative launched in 2023 to mobilise people desiring to stand for the protection of Gaza and Palestinians. They share resources to understand the situation, and help in orchestrating actions to raise awareness about the crisis.</td><td>Relaying actions, more than organising.</td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.sadaka.ie/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.sadaka.ie/">Sadaka  The Ireland Palestine Alliance</a></td><td>Ireland</td><td>The Ireland Palestine Alliance works to influence the Irish Government and EU policymakers in support of human rights.</td><td>Supported recognition of the State of Palestine.</td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.sabdscoalition.org/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.sabdscoalition.org/">South African BDS Coalition</a></td><td>South Africa</td><td>The coalition exists to bring various solidarity organisations together, under common campaigns, structures, and principles. It therefore creates a platform for the different Palestine Solidarity Organisations to work together and support one another.</td><td>Targeted boycott, divestment, and sanctions campaigns.</td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.mundubat.org/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.mundubat.org/">Mundubat</a></td><td>Spain</td><td>Mundubat has been working in Palestine since 1998, making a firm commitment to defend the rights of the Palestinian people and to establish a just peace in the region.</td><td>Human rights, food sovereignty, gender and social action campaigns.</td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.palestina.cat/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.palestina.cat/">Palestinian Community of Catalonia</a></td><td>Spain</td><td>Its mission is the defense of human rights and the right to self-determination of the Palestinian people.</td><td>Supported recognition of the State of Palestine.</td></tr><tr><td><a href="http://www.caabu.org" data-type="link" data-id="www.caabu.org">CAABU - Council for Arab-British Understanding</a></td><td>UK</td><td>CAABU works for a British Middle East policy that promotes conflict resolution, human rights and civil society in the Arab world through informed debate and mutual understanding. Caabu is one of the most active NGOs working on the Middle East in British parliament since its establishment in 1967.</td><td>"Caabu works hard to ensure that politicians and the media have the most up to date facts, statistics and analysis of the situation in Gaza."</td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://fobzu.org/" data-type="link" data-id="https://fobzu.org/">Friends of Birzeit University (Fobzu)</a></td><td>UK</td><td>Fobzu works to promote access to education for Palestinians under occupation and in exile.</td><td>Ensure UK universities &amp; international organisations are not complicit in Israels campaign to eliminate future independent Palestinian educational life in Gaza. <br>E.g. <a href="https://x.com/fobzu/status/1783852882309091364" data-type="link" data-id="https://x.com/fobzu/status/1783852882309091364">see their post on X</a></td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://palestinecampaign.org/" data-type="link" data-id="https://palestinecampaign.org/">Palestine Solidarity Campaign (PSC)</a></td><td>UK</td><td>Palestine Solidarity Campaign (PSC) is a community of people working together for peace, equality, and justice and against racism, occupation, and colonisation.</td><td><a href="https://palestinecampaign.org/emergency-response-2023/" data-type="link" data-id="https://palestinecampaign.org/emergency-response-2023/">Emergency Response: Stop the Attacks on Gaza</a></td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://uscpr.org/" data-type="link" data-id="https://uscpr.org/">US Campaign for Palestinian Rights</a></td><td>USA</td><td>USCPR works with local organizers and activists, policymakers, movement leaders, media, &amp; advocacy organizations to advance a rights-based, accountability and justice-oriented framework from the U.S. to Palestine.</td><td><a href="https://uscpr.org/take-action/" data-type="link" data-id="https://uscpr.org/take-action/">A range of campaigns</a></td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.ifnotnowmovement.org/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.ifnotnowmovement.org/">If Not Now</a></td><td>USA</td><td>We are a movement of American Jews organizing our community to end US support for Israel's apartheid system and demand equality, justice, and a thriving future for all Palestinians and Israelis.</td><td><a href="https://www.ifnotnowmovement.org/rejectaipac" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.ifnotnowmovement.org/rejectaipac">Take Action to Reject AIPAC</a></td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.cair.com/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.cair.com/">Council on American-Islamic Relations (CAIR)</a></td><td>USA</td><td>CAIRs mission is to enhance understanding of Islam, protect civil rights, promote justice, and empower American Muslims. CAIR seeks to empower the American Muslim community and encourage their participation in political and social activism.</td><td><a href="https://www.cair.com/get-involved/become-an-ally/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.cair.com/get-involved/become-an-ally/">An invite to become an ally</a></td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.aaiusa.org/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.aaiusa.org/">Arab American Institute</a></td><td>USA</td><td>Representing the interests of Arab Americans since 1985.</td><td><a href="https://www.aaiusa.org/action/demand-the-us-votes-yes-to-recognize-palestinian-statehood-at-the-un" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.aaiusa.org/action/demand-the-us-votes-yes-to-recognize-palestinian-statehood-at-the-un">Demand the US votes YES to Recognize Palestine at the UN</a></td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.jewishvoiceforpeace.org/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.jewishvoiceforpeace.org/">Jewish Voice for Peace</a></td><td>USA</td><td>JVP is a national, grassroots organization working towards Palestinian freedom and Judaism beyond Zionism. It's the largest such organization in the world. Being a member of a grassroots, national membership organization means joining a community of thousands working together towards freedom and justice for all from the U.S. to Palestine. Together, we can take actiononline, in the streets, and in our communities.</td><td><a href="https://www.jewishvoiceforpeace.org/take-action/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.jewishvoiceforpeace.org/take-action/">Take action related to Palestine</a><br><a href="https://www.jewishvoiceforpeace.org/2023/10/24/palestine-under-attack/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.jewishvoiceforpeace.org/2023/10/24/palestine-under-attack/">Join Power Half Hour, M-F</a></td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/company/we-for-p/about/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.linkedin.com/company/we-for-p/about/">We For P</a></td><td>USA</td><td>Professional support community for those who are sympathetic to the plight of the Palestinians.</td><td>Join us in creating cultures free from intimidation and retaliation. Everyone deserves workplaces that honor human rights and freedom of speech.</td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.ippnw.org/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.ippnw.org/">International Physicians for the Prevention of Nuclear War</a></td><td>Worldwide</td><td>A non-partisan federation of national medical groups in 56 countries, representing tens of thousands of doctors, medical students, other health workers, and concerned citizens who share the common goal of creating a more peaceful and secure world freed from the threat of nuclear annihilation and armed violence.</td><td>Has supported a ceasefire.</td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.amnesty.org/en/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.amnesty.org/en/">Amnesty International</a></td><td>Worldwide</td><td>Amnesty International is a global movement of more than 10 million people who are committed to creating a future where human rights are enjoyed by everyone. United by our shared humanity, we know that the power to create positive change is within all of us.</td><td>Campaigning to demand a ceasefire.</td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://www.hrw.org/" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.hrw.org/">Human Rights Watch</a></td><td>Worldwide</td><td>We direct our advocacy towards governments, armed groups and businesses, pushing them to change or enforce their laws, policies and practices.</td><td><a href="https://www.hrw.org/news/2024/06/19/human-rights-watch-statement-56th-regular-session-un-human-rights-council" data-type="link" data-id="https://www.hrw.org/news/2024/06/19/human-rights-watch-statement-56th-regular-session-un-human-rights-council">Made a statement to the U.N. Human Rights Council</a></td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://act.oxfamamerica.org/page/67344" data-type="link" data-id="https://act.oxfamamerica.org/page/67344">Oxfam</a></td><td>Worldwide</td><td>Oxfam and partners continue to deliver assistance for Palestinians enduring conflict, while advocating for a ceasefire, the return of all hostages, and full humanitarian access to Gaza.</td><td>Oxfam is urging the Biden administration to stop arms transfers to Israel, prioritize a permanent ceasefire, secure the release of all remaining hostages, and allow unimpeded access for humanitarian aid to reach the civilians who need it right now.</td></tr><tr><td><a href="https://visualizingpalestine.org/" data-type="link" data-id="https://visualizingpalestine.org/">Visualizing Palestine</a></td><td>Worldwide</td><td>Visualizing Palestine uses data and research to visually communicate Palestinian experiences to provoke narrative change.</td><td>Since 2012, Visualizing Palestine has equipped organizers, educators, and students with over 200 visual tools that center Palestinian experiences and bring awareness to Palestinian narratives.</td></tr></tbody></table></figure>
<!-- /wp:table -->

<!-- wp:buttons {"layout":{"type":"flex","justifyContent":"center"}} -->
<div class="wp-block-buttons"><!-- wp:button {"textAlign":"center","width":50} -->
<div class="wp-block-button has-custom-width wp-block-button__width-50"><a class="wp-block-button__link has-text-align-center wp-element-button" href="https://www.bystandersnomore.com/take-action/">Return to Take Action page</a></div>
<!-- /wp:button --></div>
<!-- /wp:buttons -->]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:post_modified_gmt><![CDATA[2024-07-12 18:54:44]]></wp:post_modified_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status><![CDATA[closed]]></wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name><![CDATA[organisations-to-support]]></wp:post_name>
		<wp:status><![CDATA[publish]]></wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type><![CDATA[post]]></wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password><![CDATA[]]></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
										<category domain="category" nicename="take-action"><![CDATA[Take Action]]></category>
						<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_edit_last]]></wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[4]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_page_template]]></wp:meta_key>

							<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key><![CDATA[_wp_old_slug]]></wp:meta_key>
